channel.title: Alaska HDTV | AppleTV HD Format
channel.description: Alaska HDTV shares the Alaska experience in high definition offering Adventures, Travel, SanitySaver, Hikes, and Interviews.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Experience Alaska in High Definition with Scott Slone.
channel.itunes:summary: Alaska HDTV is a series of shows produced in high definition sharing the Alaska experience with a global audience. Become an Alaska Insider today!
channel.itunes:author: Scott Slone

image.title: Alaska HDTV | Alaska's hottest video show (alaskahdtv)

item.title: SanitySaver [HD] | For the Birds
item.description: After much needed rain here in Anchorage, Scott decided to take his camera out to some of his favorite wetlands here in Anchorage area. Enjoy this weeks Sanity Saver "For the Birds" More on this show and others like it at www.alaskahdtv.com
item.itunes:author: Scott Slone
item.author: scott@alaskapodshow.com (Scott Slone)
item.itunes:subtitle: Experience Alaska in High Definition with Scott Slone.
item.itunes:summary: Alaska HDTV is a series of shows produced in high definition geared to sharing the real Alaska experience to a global audience. Experience Alaska with Scott Slone a 5th generation Alaskan passionate about making you an Alaska Insider.

item.title: Hike of the Week (HD) | Spring Hike Up Flattop
item.description: Hiking in Alaska can sometimes be unpredictable, especially in the mountains. This early spring hike was a mix of snowy trails, mud, rocks, dust and lots of high winds. Getting out and summiting a local hill can still be a great time, despite the spring conditions.

item.title: Hike of the Week (HD) | Campbell Creek Tract-Bicentennial Park
item.description: Anchorage Alaska Hike Enjoy an Easy family friendly trail right here in Anchorage. A few hills scattered here and there but pretty much level. If desired, some trails gently slope up the Chugach Mountains. More information on this hike at: http://www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Adventure [HD]| Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes
item.description: The Valley of the Ten Thousand Smokes, a forty square mile, 100 to 700 foot deep ash flow deposited by Novarupta Volcano. Join Alaska HDTV as we take you into the heart of Katmai National Park to view this amazing area.

item.description: There is nothing better to escape from reality than to take to the air! Join us as we relive and experience some of Alaska's aviation from past episodes. More on this show at: http://www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Adventure [HD] | Kodiak Island Adventure I AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: My friends, if you're planning your summer trips this year let me suggest putting the great Emerald Isle of Alaska on your list! Kodiak in my opinion is the great summer destination hands down. Kodiak offers amazing and wild coastline, fishing, hunting, hiking, eating, ocean, whales... and is home to some of Alaska's biggest brown bears! - So you tell me... is there anything Kodiak doesn't offer?
item.itunes:author: Scott Slone

item.title: Hike of the Week [HD] | Mt.Alyeska Day Hike | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Production note: This was filmed in the fall of 2008 while Scott was rolling tape on a hike with his son. We thought it would be fun and inspiring to get everyone in the spirit of summer hiking! Summer is just around the corner, and spring is a great time to begin planning your summer hikes and adventures! Join Scott and his Son Coleson as they introduce hiking at Mount Alyeska located in Girdwood, Alaska. Mt. Alyeska is a popular local mountain offering great summer hikes for everyone at any level. We took the Tram from the Alyeska Prince Hotel and began our hike from the historic resort Roundhouse. More details on this hike at: www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Adventure [HD]| Snowkiting in Alaska I AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Alaska Travel Aventure We head out for a little winter adventure and run into some locals getting outside and having fun in the Alaska outdoors. item.description: Greetings! It's been busy here at Alaska HDTV prepping for Season II, and I finally had time to finish putting together the start highlights from Iditarod 2009. Better late then never I hope you enjoy! Make sure to visit our website at www.alaskahdtv.com Cheers, Scott

item.title: Event [HD] | SCCA RallyCross | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Alaska HDTV Presents: Event mashup of the SCCA Alaska Arctic Region And now for something entirely off the regular beat of hikes, beautiful scenery and the Alaska travel videos. Scott and I were looking for something with a little more motorized energy and dropped by the first RallyCross event of the 2008-2009 winter season. The Arctic Alaska Region of the SCCA (Sports Car Club of America) hosts several car racing events throughout the year, but in my opinion, the rally racing is by far the most fun! More shows like this at www.alaskahdtv.com Cheers, Scott

item.title: Hike of the Week [HD] | Silver Fern Trail | AlaskaHDTV.com
item.description: Season Greetings, Welcome to the Winter edition of the Hike of the Week! This hike takes us just outside the city of Anchorage on upper hillside to the Silver Fern Spur Trail. This trail system is your connection to a variety of incredible hikes into the Chugach Park System. Silver Fern Trail is a 1.3 mile trail that connect with Gas Line trail, which if taken will lead you up to Powerline trail, Flattop Mountain and beyond! We're taking a short loop today, which totals at 2.6 miles long. To sum up this hike: Close to town, scenic, not strenuous, but has potential if hiked at a faster pace, and never very crowded! Enjoy! Scott

item.title: Adventure | Wrangell, Stikine River | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
Alaska HDTV Presents: Stikine River from Wrangell Alaska

Join Scott as he travels to Wrangell, then takes a journey on the Chutine Warrior jet boat up the Stikine River for another adventure in SE aalaska. Alaska HDTV returns to Wrangell, Alaska for another multi-part video adventure with our friends Jim & Wilma Leslie at Alaska Waters.

Visit our website: www.AlaskaHDTV.com for more information and complete show notes.

Thanks for watching,

Scott

item.title: Insider Update | Our first catch and release! | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
We're happy to announce the soon to be released first season of Alaska HDTV episodes on DVD! Our first DVD title "Year One, Our first catch and release." is scheduled for release on September 16, 2008. Reserve your copy today! More details about the Pre-order here.

This first DVD of Alaska HDTV shows originally shot in high definition will include several episodes from all or series, such as SanitySavers, Adventures and our Hike of the Week shows. Some of the shows included: Hike of the week with Governor Sarah Palin, ice climbing in Wrangell St. Elias National Park and our roadtrip to Valdez to see the May Day Fly-in. Visit Alaska HDTV for more details about the Pre-order.

item.title: SanitySaver | ZEN the BIG WILD LIFE | Alaska HDTV
item.description: Alaska HDTV Presents: "ZEN the BIG WILD LIFE" Enjoy beautiful places around Alaska with a mix of Alaska wildlife. Featured wildlife includes bears of Katmai National Park, bears of AnAn near Wrangell, local wildlife around Anchorage, sea life from Seward, Valdez and Kodiak. Music in this show comes from the amazing guitarist Andy McKee with his song Nakagawa-san from his CD The Gates of Gnomeria, visit his website www.andymckee.com- enjoy the show! More shows like this one at www.alaskahdtv.com! Scott

item.title: (AppleTV Fix) Hike of the Week | Hatcher Pass | Alaska HDTV
item.description: Alaska HDTV Presents: Hatcher Pass "Unknown" hike. Greetings Hike of the Week fans! We originally had another hike planned but the pass was not open through to Summit Lake, so the hike was diverted to a spontaneous location I've not hiked in over ten years. We'll call this one though a very scenic, family friendly, and not heavily traveled hike from what I could see. It's July 2nd as I write this and we've still a fare amount of snow still on the ground with early spring still coming through in areas above 2000 feet. Enjoy the SHOW Scott Alaska HDTV www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Hike of the Week | Tony Knowles Coastal Trail | Alaska HDTV
item.description:
Alaska HDTV Presents: Tony Knowles Coastal Trail

Take an easy hike along the Anchorage Coastal Trail, or take in the amazing views, great people, and wildlife the entire 11 mile coastal trail has to offer.

The Tony Knowles Coastal Trail is the backbone of Anchorage's trail system making it possible to travel anywhere in Anchorage by Walking, Running, bike, skiing, or whatever get's you around without a motor! Wherever you want to go the trail will get you there!

Stay up to date on Alaska! Subscribe to our show at www.alaskahdtv.com

Cheers! Scott

Alaska HDTV Making you an Alaska Insider! www.alaskahdtv.com

item.title: Insider Update | April Showers? | Alaska HDTV
item.description: <p>April Showers? Global Cooling? Where's Al Gore? Winter in Anchorage, Alaska is not yet over - April 25th, 2008 we recieved 17 inches!</p><p>Music by: Ken Waldman <a href="http://www.kenwaldman.com" target="_blank" title="Ken Waldman">www.kenwaldman.com</a> </p><p>More at Alaska HDTV: <a href="http://www.alaskapodshow.com" title="Alaska HDTV">www.alaskapodshow.com </a></p><p>Cheers,</p><p>Scott </p>

item.title: Hike of the Week | Archangel Valley | Alaska HDTV
item.description:

item.title: Adventure | Winterlake Lodge | Alaska HDTV
item.description: Alaska HDTV Presents: Winterlake Lodge, located 200 Miles northwest of Anchorage in the remote Alaska wilderness. More information on this show at: www.alaskapodshow.com Credits: David Beard @ www.davidbeardmusic.com Kimo Watanabe "Malie" @ music.podshow.com Killer and amazing badwidth provided by PodShow Network! www.PodShow.com Cheers! Scott

item.title: Adventure | Kodiak Island (Winter) | Alaska Podshow
item.description:
Alaska Podshow #180 Welcome to our winter show from Kodiak, Alaska! Join us as we chase liquid sunshine, explore WWII bunkers, and hike the Kodiak Island rugged cliffs, and experience temperate rain forests of Fort Abercrombie State Historical Park. Complete details on this Adventure available at www.alaskapodshow

Thanks for subscribing into the Alaska Podshow! Comments and feedback call +1 206.973.7469 or email alaskapodshow@gmail.com Cheers, Scott
